org.mcavallo.opencloud
Class Cloud

java.lang.Object
  org.mcavallo.opencloud.Cloud

public class Cloud
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class representing a tag cloud.

addText

public void addText(java.lang.String text,
                    java.lang.String linkFormat)
Extracts tags from a text. Each tag is assigned a link based on the provided format string. The format string can have zero or one format specifier, for example "/www.google.com/search?q=%s". If there isn't any format specifier the link is constant, otherwise the format specifier will be substituted with the tag name.

Parameters:
text - Text to parse
linkFormat - Format string that defines the tags link. It can have at most one parateter that will be subsituted with the tag name.

addText

public void addText(java.lang.String text)
Extracts tags from a text. Each tag is assigned the default link.

Parameters:
text - Text to parse

getTag

public Tag getTag(java.lang.String name)
Returns the tag with the given name, or null if the tag is not present in the cloud.

Parameters:
name - Tag name
Returns:
The tag with the specified name

getTag

public Tag getTag(Tag tag)

Parameters:
tag - Tag to search
Returns:
The tag corresponding to the specified tag

isValid

public static boolean isValid(Tag tag)
Checks whether name and score value of the tag are consistent .

Returns:
True if the tag is valid

tags

public java.util.List<Tag> tags()
Returns a list containing the tags to display, sorted by name. The weight of the returned tags is correctly set.

Returns:
A list containing the output tags

tags

public java.util.List<Tag> tags(java.util.Comparator<? super Tag> comparator)
Returns a list containing the tags to display, sorted using the given comparator. The weight of the returned tags is correctly set.

Parameters:
comparator - The Comparator that determines the ordering
Returns:
A list containing the output tags

allTags

public java.util.List<Tag> allTags(java.util.Comparator<? super Tag> comparator)
Returns a list containing all tags present in the cloud, sorted using the given comparator. The weight of the returned tags is not set.

Parameters:
comparator - The Comparator that determines the ordering
Returns:
A List containing all cloud tags

allTags

public java.util.List<Tag> allTags()
Returns a list containing all tags present in the cloud. The weight of the returned tags is not set.

Returns:
A List containing all cloud tags

Returns:
The maximum number of tags to display in the cloud

setMaxTagsToDisplay

public void setMaxTagsToDisplay(int maxTagsToDisplay)
Sets the maximum number of tags to display in the cloud. If the argument is negative the number of displayed tags will not be limited.

Parameters:
maxTagsToDisplay - The number of tags

getNormThreshold

public double getNormThreshold()
Returns:
The normalized score threshold.

setNormThreshold

public void setNormThreshold(double threshold)
Sets the normalized score threshold. Tags with their normalized score under the threshold will not be displayed.

Parameters:
threshold - The threshold value

getTagLifetime

setTagLifetime

public void setTagLifetime(long tagLifetime)
Sets the maximum lifetime of a tag in milliseconds. Old tags are removed.

Parameters:

getTagCase

public Cloud.Case getTagCase()
Returns:
The tag case

setTagCase

public void setTagCase(Cloud.Case tagCase)
Sets the case of the tags. To have a consistent behavior the case must be set before any tag is added to the cloud.

Parameters:
tagCase - The tag case to set

getLocale

public java.util.Locale getLocale()
Returns:
The locale associated with the cloud

setLocale

public void setLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
Sets the locale of the cloud. This have to be set only if different from the default locale. To have a consistent behavior the locale must be set before any tag is added to the cloud.

Parameters:
locale - The locale to set

getDefaultLink

public java.lang.String getDefaultLink()
Returns:
The format string representing the default link

setDefaultLink

public void setDefaultLink(java.lang.String defaultLink)
Sets the format string representing the default link (e.g. "/www.google.com/search?q=%s"). The first format specifier will be substituted b the tag name.

Parameters:
defaultLink - Format string representing the default link (e.g. "/www.google.com/search?q=%s")
